reviews.text: It's a means to get in or out of Glossop. Centrally located. There's a waiting room, Twig coffee place and a vending machine. No toilets. What more to say?

The staff are efficient and friendly, they give advice on what is the most cost effective route to take. The trains are regularly running and not very often delayed. 
There is a coffee shop and easy disabled access.

Lovely, clean and (when sunny) bright station. Friendly coffee shop. Can be very cold in winter though since the waiting room is closed. The barriers are a bit of a pain but (and this REALLY winds up my friends), since I have a Greater Manchester bus pass I get here for FREE - Glossop bus pass holders CAN'T. Oh dear me! 😂😂😂

Nice clean little train station with a coop and post office next door, on the weekends you get all the odd lot coming down from thills going into Manchester, most are nice but it's best not to look at them as they can nip you.

A cute little traditional train station which my little boy loves! It is in the heart of glossop so the shops are right next to it, there is a ticket office, waiting rooms and friendly and helpful staff
